The volume of the parallelepiped determined by the three-dimensional vectors $\mathbf{a}$, $\mathbf{b}$, and $\mathbf{c}$ is 4.  Find the volume of the parallelepiped determined by the vectors $\mathbf{a} + \mathbf{b},$ $\mathbf{b} + 3 \mathbf{c},$ and $\mathbf{c} - 7 \mathbf{a}.$
inference:
The volume of the parallelepiped determined by the vectors $\mathbf{a}$, $\mathbf{b}$, and $\mathbf{c}$ is given by $|\mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c})| = 4$.  The volume of the parallelepiped determined by the vectors $\mathbf{a} + \mathbf{b}$, $\mathbf{b} + 3 \mathbf{c}$, and $\mathbf{c} - 7 \mathbf{a}$ is given by
\begin{align*} | (\mathbf{a} + \mathbf{b}) \cdot ((\mathbf{b} + 3 \mathbf{c}) \times (\mathbf{c} - 7 \mathbf{a}))| &= | (\mathbf{a} + \mathbf{b}) \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c} - 7 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b} + 3 \mathbf{c} \times \mathbf{c} - 21 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{c})| \\ &= | (\mathbf{a} + \mathbf{b}) \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c} - 7 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b} - 21 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{c})| \\ &= | (\mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c}) - 7 \mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}) - 21 \mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{c}) + \mathbf{b} \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c}) - 7 \mathbf{b} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}) - 21 \mathbf{b} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{c}))| \\ &= | \mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c}) + \mathbf{b} \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c}) - 7 \mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}) - 21 \mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{c}) - 7 \mathbf{b} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}) - 21 \mathbf{b} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{c})| \end{align*}Since $\mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}) = \mathbf{b} \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c}) = \mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{c}) = 0$, we have
\begin{align*} | (\mathbf{a} + \mathbf{b}) \cdot ((\mathbf{b} + 3 \mathbf{c}) \times (\mathbf{c} - 7 \mathbf{a}))| &= |\mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c}) - 7 \mathbf{b} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}) - 21 \mathbf{b} \cdot (\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{c})| \\ &= |4 - 7(0) - 21(0)| = |4| = 4. \end{align*}Final Answer: $\boxed{4}$

&= \mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c}) - 7 \mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{a}) - 21 \mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{c} \times \mathbf{a}) \\
